means: 限制，节省（stint的过去式与过去分词形式）

sentence.Network_en: Penny - pinching landlords stinted their tenants on heat and hot water.
sentence.Network_cn: 小气的房东在房客的取暖和热水供应上进行克扣.

sentence.Network_en: She stinted herself of food in order to let the children have enough.
sentence.Network_cn: 她自己省着吃,好让孩子们吃饱.

sentence.Network_en: While the government has poured money recklessly into health, it has stinted on infrastructure.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府在卫生健康项目上不假思索地大把大把砸钱, 对基础设施建设却十分吝啬.

list.abs: His managerial experience includes stints with companies affiliated with Anheuser - Busch and Gallo Winery ., 他的管理经验包括效力关联公司安海斯和盖洛酿酒厂.
中国语単语例文集11 &laquo; dream_nimin131... ... 部位 position 不惜 not stint 不相上下 equally matched.
不_互动百科 ... [confuse right and wrong] 见“不分清红皂白” [not stint] 不顾惜 [be too busy;have no time] 没有空闲,来不及.
It also became clear during that stint , that the tyre degradation was very low ., 也是在那个阶段 , 轮胎磨损显然非常的慢.
stint sb of... ... scamp work and stint material 偷工减料 stint oneself 省吃俭用 stint sb in food 限制某人的食物.
